title: (x) Suggestion for a Font Similar to this Writing - various suggestions {gang}
content:
Could anyone suggest a font that has a similar look to the writing on the title card from Imitation of Life?

I've said it before, but I'll say it again - thank you all in advance so much for sharing your talents so freely. This is probably the most useful resource I've ever come across.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613im_/http:/typophile.com/files/imitation_5137.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [imitation.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/typophile.com/files/imitation.jpg) | 42.15 KB |
author: brendanmcguigan

comments.content:
Hi Brendan,  
what about [Olicana](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/typographica.org/2008/typeface-reviews/olicana/)?  
Also:  
 [Sonora](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/sonora/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dimitation%2520of%2520life%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D23?refby=mfde)  
 [Spring](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/spring-lp/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dimitation%2520of%2520life%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D23?refby=mfde)  
F

Thanks Florian.

It's also a bit like another of my scripts; [Gizmo.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/www.type.co.uk/a_to_z_listing/id/11238)

Since you two already mentioned both of Nick's fonts, I'll add another that resembles this mostly because it has a strangely emotional weirdness to the lettering. It's called [DEADman](http://web.archive.org/web/20100301075613/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/volcano/deadman/?testdrive=custom%3D37994%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dimitation%2520of%2520life%26size%3D44%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3DFFFFFF%26w%3D600%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26dock%3Dfalse%26seed%3D23) from Volcano (Christoph Seiler). It comes with blobs and spatters too, like Olicana Rough has, I think.

- Mike Yanega
